item.title: about me
item.description: current assistant professor of statistics Econometric Institute, Erasmus School of Economics, Erasmus University Rotterdam past research fellow of statistics Department of Law and Economics, UnitelmaSapienza University of Rome education dutch university teaching qualification (BKO) Risbo - Erasmus University Rotterdam (2022) phd in methodological statistics at La Sapienza University of Rome (2020) msc in statistics and decision sciences at La Sapienza University of Rome (2016) bsc in statistics at La Sapienza University of Rome (2013) awards and grants research grant for junior researcher “Avvio alla ricerca” (2017) award in Stats under the Stars (an Italian Statistical Society competition): best report (2017) phd scholarishp (3 years) at La Sapienza University of Rome (2016) academic services programme committee member of the conference CLADAG 2023 (2023) session organizer and chair of the “CMStatistics 2022: 15th International Conference of the ERCIM WG on Computational and Methodological Statistics” (2022) session organizer of the “ECDA 2022: European Conference on Data Analysis” (2022) programme committee member of the hackhaton “HackTheGene” (2022) committee member of the prize “Premio TStat Training” (2022) national coordinator (2022) and member of the national board of young SIS (2021-2022) programme committee member of “SIS 2022: the 51st Scientific Meeting of the Italian Statistical Society” (2022) programme committee member of the conference “IES 2022: Innovation and Society 5.

item.title: events
item.description: future conferences 64th ISI World Statistics Congress (July 16-20, 2023 - Ottawa, Canada) CMStatistics 2022: 15th International Conference of the ERCIM WG on Computational and Methodological Statistics (December 17-19, 2022 - London, UK) recent events IFCS 2022: 17th conference of the International Federation of Classification Societies (July 19-23, 2022 - Porto, Portugal) SIS 2022: 51st Scientific Meeting of the Italian Statistical Society (June 22-24, 2022 - Caserta, Italy) EcoSta 2022: 5th International Conference on Econometrics and Statistics (June 4-6, 2022 - Kyoto, Japan) IES 2022: Innovation and Society 5.

item.title: materials and info
item.description: I am a statistician and my research is focused on the methodological and computational aspects of data analysis. The best feeling is when I can use my knowledge to solve practical and real problems. I am currently working on latent variable models, unsupervised classification and model-based composite indicators. ongoing projects seminars and talks events teaching material

item.title: ongoing projects
item.description: my current research consists of: A new ranking calculation based on a composite indicator model: the case of the top 20 European football teams (Cavicchia, C. and Sarnacchiaro, P.) Revision requested A model-based ultrametric composite indicator for studying waste management in Italian municipalities (Cavicchia, C., Sarnacchiaro, P., Vichi, M. and Zaccaria, G.) Revision requested Convex Clustering of Mixed Numerical and Categorical Data (Brink, T., Cavicchia, C.

item.title: seminars and talks
item.description: seminars and invited talks A composite indicator for circular economy performance - ISI 2023: International Statistical Institute World Statistics Congress (2023 - Ottawa, Canada) Mixed Data Convex Clustering - CMStatistics 2022: 15th International Conference of the ERCIM WG on Computational and Methodological Statistics (2022 - London, UK - Virtual) A general framework for implementing distance measures for categorical variables - IFCS 2022: 17th conference of the International Federation of Classification Societies (2022 - Porto, Portugal)

item.title: teaching material
item.description: supervisions I am currently supervising five msc theses in Econometrics and three msc theses in Data Science for Marketing Analytics at Erasmus School of Economics this year I am second assessor of three msc theses in Econometrics, three msc theses in Data Science for Marketing Analytics and five bsc theses in Econometrics at Erasmus School of Economics in the past few years I supervised three msc theses in Econometrics (on mixed-type data clustering methods and latent dirichlet allocation), three msc theses in Data Science for Marketing Analytics (on supervised machine learning methods), and nineteen bsc theses in Econometrics (on Cavicchia, Vichi and Zaccaria (2022), Adachi and Trendafilov (2018), Vichi and Kiers (2001) and Bluszcz (2016)) at Erasmus School of Economics
